intro: Sheilanthera pubens, commonly known as the hairy sheilanthera, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
